about.p1: I love to combine both technology and creativity to create tools and software that will help people in their job and make their life easier. As a good team player and a hard worker, I want to solve complex problems and work on exciting projects. I'm a generalist, and I'm passionate about constantly learning new things in various fields.
about.p2: I have a computer science engineering degree from Polytech, an engineering school based in Grenoble (in the French Alps). Over the courses and the projects I have participated in, I have learned several programming languages and aspects of computer science, which gave me a global and complete vision of this broad domain. I'm a fast learner and I can adapt quickly to any kind of project.
about.p3: If you have a question or you are interested in my profile, feel free to contact me !

work.intro: Here is a selection of projects I have worked on. Some of my them are available on my GitHub.

projects.name: Full stack medical application
projects.description: Full stack web app for doctors and nurses to help detect malnutrition in nursing homes. It is a school project developed by a team of 6 using agile practices. My roles: frontend, DevOps and scrum master. Generated with JHipster, the application uses Angular for the frontend and Java Spring Boot for the backend. I used GitHub actions to create CI/CD pipelines, containerized the application with Docker and deployed it on an Azure VM.

projects.name: Snow and avalanche map
projects.description: Interactive map updated daily displaying data about snow and avalanches. It provides an overview of the latest weather conditions and thus possible avalanche risks, helping the users of Skitour to prepare for their ski trip in complete safety. The map has been developed with Leaflet (frontend) and PHP (backend), by a team of 4 using agile practices.

projects.name: Electronic cards test interface
projects.description: Complete user interface I made with Angular, ElectronJS and MySQL during a 3 month-internship, to manage tests of electronic cards that are manufactured by the company. With this software, the user can launch test scripts on a card with a hardware bench, consult previous test history with all the stored data, and visualize graphs and statistics in order to detect potential problems and improve the engineering process.

projects.name: DAAM (video game)
projects.description: Video game developed in Java for a school project, at the end of my 3rd year. The game has been carried out in 3 weeks from scratch by a group of 6 students, under specific constraints such as the use of automata and the MVC structure (Model View Controller).

projects.name: Project Robin
projects.description: Experimental project using AI applied to sound recognition on an embedded device. That was my 4th year end project completed in a few weeks by a team of 3. Using EdgeImpulse and the Wio Terminal, our model classified animal noises and printed out its prediction with probabilities. Very interesting work that made me improve my knowledge of embedded programming and AI model training.

projects.name: Contrails.js
projects.description: Simple JavaScript library to create airplane contrails animation. It's a small project I did to practice and test the canvas feature on a website, but it was quite fun to make and I'm satisfied with the result.
